title: 'He will soon be among the best': Ronaldinho backs Vinicius Jr to be one of the world's best players
text:
Former Brazil star Ronaldinho has backed compatriot Vinicius Jr to be one of the world's best players in the future.

The 19-year-old enjoyed a breakthrough year at Real Madrid last season, but has struggled for minutes on the pitch so far this campaign under Zinedine Zidane.

But Ronaldinho, who won the 2002 World Cup and played for Real's rivals Barcelona, believes the forward is at one of the best clubs in the world to develop.

Ronaldinho was speaking to reporters in Colombia ahead of two exhibition matches

Vinicus Jr has not been a regular in the starting XI for Zidane's Real Madrid so far this year

Speaking ahead of playing two exhibition matches in Colombia, Ronaldinho said: '[Vinicius] is already at one of the best clubs in the world.

'I think he will soon be there, among the best.'

Ronaldinho, who played for Barcelona between 2003-2008, also complimented Lionel Messi about his reading of the game.

The 39-year-old was team-mates with Messi for four years at Barca, but was famously turfed out by Pep Guardiola in order to allow the Argentine to flourish in attack.

'I think it is very important for every team to have a player who has this characteristic so that the attackers can receive good passes,' he said of Messi's passing vision.

Ronaldinho was at Barcelona when Lionel Messi first broke through into the first-team

Ahead of El Clasico on October 26, Ronaldinho hoped that the stars on both sides showed up.

There are doubts about the location of the match due to protests in the Catalan region - the match is scheduled to be held at Barcelona's Camp Nou.

Ronaldinho said of the game itself: 'I hope it's a great game, that it has many goals and that the big names show up.'
